name: Playing with Sets : Union
description: [Set](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set) objects are new JavaScript built-in objects defined since [ECMAScript 2015](http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/6.0/#sec-set-objects.) A **Set** lets you store unique values of any type. It comes with some useful methods like `.add`, `.clear`, `.has` . . . **BUT** some "Set operations" are missing, like . . . # Union Two sets can be "added" together. The union of A and B, denoted by A ∪ B, is the set of all things that are members of either A or B. ### Examples: ``` {1, 2} ∪ {1, 2} = {1, 2}. {1, 2} ∪ {2, 3} = {1, 2, 3}. {1, 2, 3} ∪ {3, 4, 5} = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} ``` # Task Create function `union` getting 2 sets as arguments and returning a **new Set** as result of union of these 2 sets. ### Examples: ```javascript A = new Set([1,2]); B = new Set([2,3]); C = union(A,B) // -> {1,2,3} ```   " May the Code be with you ! "
